author: starwarsgeek101_
title: Snowtrooper Value Pack
review: Although this set comes at a price, I think it is worth it. The new style helmet for the AT-AT driver is amazing, as well as the new imperial officer. The little base is OK, it provides a satellite and a rotating missle launcher. The snowspeeder bike is what makes this set complete. So overall, I give it a 9.5/10.

author: legoclone
title: Good set but would have liked one more snowtrooper.
review:
This is a decent kit to build your Army but I just wish that in these battle packs Lego would give you 3 of the basic soldiers and 1 special mini-fig like they did with last year's clone trooper pack.  That one was perfect because you could collect a lot of clone troopers quicker with multiple sets and thus could fill the various vehicles like the Gunship and AT-TE with troopers.  Don't get me wrong with this one, I DO like the AT-AT driver, however,  I just don't need a bunch of AT-AT drivers if I buy multiple sets (especially seeing as how the AT-AT comes with one anyways) and thus would rather have that extra snow trooper with each kit instead.  Please keep this in mind Lego if you're ever going to do another battle pack with Episode III clone troopers. 

Anyways, the speeder bike is really cool.  The other thing...well, it leaves you some good parts for the spare parts box including a decent radar screen and missile and an imperial officer to help command your various imperial forces.  I intend to put him in the Endor set's Scout Walker (which really should have come with its own AT-ST driver).

author: 18000pieces
title: TWO extras? Astonishing!
review:
For the first time since the original Clone BP, we get two whole extras! And they're both good! It's wondrous! But anyway, here's an analysis of all of the BP's aspects:


--Minifigures - There's a wide assortment for a BP, only two being the same. The snowtroopers aren't new, just rather rare, and it's nice to have two of them in a cheap set. 

However, LEGO must be trying to keep them relatively scarce, as instead of having a third one manning the turret, they've employed an AT-AT driver, oddly removed from his AT-AT. The helmet is rather bulky, but the torso is nice. 

Last but not least, we have the imperial officer, with his ever-so-stylish 'durasteel sheperd headwrap' look and incomprehensible rank symbol. He's got a generic IJ Nazi head, but the facial expression fits him well. His nose must be getting pretty chilly, though. Oh, wait, he doesn't have a nose. Works for him!


--Snow Speeder - it uses the tricycle mold, similar to Battle of Endor, but in with a white top. That forms the main part of the build, really. The front utilizes two of the new headlight pieces with a stud on the side in white, which are something of an improvement over the old version, although they don't have holes in the back. There's an old-school megaphone gun on one side.

--Base - Only the second stationary BP component so far, the first one being the turret in the original clone BP, the 'base' is... interesting. It looks sort of like something that could have been dropped from the belly of a modified AT-AT, I guess. 

The radar station half is simply adorable, although I don't see what use it would be as far as tactics go. It comes with a printed piece, though! And clips for holding the guns are a plus.

The turret comes clost to having a play feature, the ability to angle the missile by turning the gear on the other side. The angle is restricted to an arc of about 45 degrees, and it's impossible to flick it properly when it's pointing up, but it's the though that counts. It certainly looks better pointing up than pointing out. The entire turret can rotate well too, and I'll never say no to another trans-red tile (future blood!). The missile itself is a nice departure from the usual two-piece flickfire, although it often comes apart.

--Accessories - The only place where this set disappoints is the number of blasters - one long one, two short, and that's it. One of 'em has to go unarmed. Maybe veers can smash the rebels over the head with his binoculars.

--Box - normally I wouldn't include a section for this, but I would just like to say that it bugs the HECK out of me that the box has clones on it. It makes me want to slap George Lucas in the face.

All in all, it's a nice little set, well worth the $11, useful for dioramas or just playing around. I look forward to getting the rebel BP to pair up with it.

author: clone_captian_cazooki
title: Awesome!
review:
I just picked this up at my local TRU and it does not disapoint.

Pros -
- at at driver
- imperial officer
- speeder
- binoculars

cons
- they could give you 3 snow troopers

overall great set and cool minifigs

author: Niallskie
title: Speeder army to come.
review:
Got this set today at our local Target for just $10.99, good thing I did not picked up this set at a TRU last week that was jacked up to $14.99, which I thought was the actual retail price of 2010 BP. Awesome thing is that it started to snow after I got this set as well as the 8083, opened them right off the bath and posed them in the snow doing battle.

  On to the review, I love this set as much as the 8083. All 4 figures are awesome, love the extra 2 Snow Trooper specially for a set this cheap. I'm not sure if the Snow Trooper back pack design is new (haven't compared it with the old one) but it looks fantastic. The Imperial Officer is also cool, love the head gear as well as the torso print which is almost the same as the Snow Troopers. The AT-AT driver is kinda out of place for me as there is no AT-AT to drive on this set LOL, but it's an addition that is welcome to this set specially the helmet is a new design. Helmet looks a tad bigger than usual but it does not matter as it still looks cute like the anime chibi (which I think the lego minifigures are meant to be cute). The small base is as good as it gets, compromised with the small amount of bricks the set have it's a good build. Radar station is cool with the blaster rack on the side, missile torret is also fantastic, only thing I did not like is that the missile is either pointed straight or at a 45 degree angle. Would have been nice too if the put a chair piece there than none at all. Now the speeder bike, who doesn't like a speeder bike I tell you, and with this cheap set you can build an army of it too. For me this is the best speeder design as of yet, and you can only get this from the past year's sets were from Echo Base and the Republic Gunship. At ebay as well the sell these from the previous sets sell's from $8-$10 a piece. Now it is available for a  measly $10.99 with 4 other minifigures and small base. Now who would not go crazy for these set, go figure!

author: Dino5667
title: Ehhhhh, Meh + Good
review:
Good set, i will buy only 1, spend the rest of my tenners on the clone battle pack(s), But still....

Pros:
+ Snow troopers!
+ Snow Speeder!
+ Nice Imperial Engineer!

Cons: 
- Suckish base, the could of at least but 10 little white bricks on it.
- I hate flick misiles.....

2 Cons, 3 Pros....... 3/5

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: snowtroopers have entered the base!
review:
I bought 3 of these sets for $16 USD at Toys R Us, but don't be fooled, you can get it cheaper for $11 at Target, or just buy it directly at the Lego Store. I saw a guy buying 9 of each battle pack, and he was pretty smart, here are the reasons why:
Pros:
-Introducing 2 new minifigs, the AT-AT pilot and the imperial officer. This AT-AT pilot is totally different from the 2007 AT-AT pilot. Believe me, this looks better than the 2007 one. The new addition is the imperial officer, which is totally different than the AT-ST pilot and imperial officer minifigs in the past. 
-It comes with a speeder, and it looks pretty sweet. has a good color scheme, which is white, and grey, that can blend with the surroundings on Hoth!
Cons:
-What troubled me the most was the imperial outpost. The officers is hiding behind the controls looking through his bionoculars, and right next to him, an AT-AT pilot manning a harpoon gun! Definately not an outpost, and another small flaw which is not seen on the box: The white bricks where the officer is hiding behind is not completed, and one of the bricks is actually controls. As everyone knows, a control brick is a slanted 2x2 brick, which sits on top of 2 other bricks. Unfortuately, a corner of the 2x2 brick sticks out, which is a major flaw in the set. if you haven't noticed, this set is 5 bricks less than the rebel battle pack, they could have just added in a white 1x1 brick to fill in the corner!
-Another flaw was the harpoon gun, or the huge missle launcher. extremely bulky. you can aim the gun, but it can fall of, because the end piece isn't sealed off. for me, while i was checking out this new set, the missle kept sliding off of the long stick that holds it. The designer must have never thought of it.

Personally, the set is not bad, a great army builder, and you can set it up like on the battle of hoth. My sets are set up right now, in battle style in the display case. It goes well with the 2007 AT-AT, 2007 Echo Base, and the 2009 Echo Base. Right now it is displayed with all of these sets. I encourage you to buy it, despite the minor flaws, with a little modifying and tweaking, you can make it a pretty awesome set, maybe even worth to buy 9 of these! :)
-Da_LegoBuilder

author: arctrooper170
title: The Empire is on the march
review: "Watch out rebels these snowtroopers mean business and are ready for action with snowspeeder and battle station to mark your position. This is another amazing set and is great when you use it against the 8083 Rebel Trooper Battle Pack. The battle station is small but can fit 3 minifigures on it and has rocketstation and a computer to track the rebels lurking in the snow. The snowtoopers havent changed from the hoth rebel base or motorized walking at-at but there is no need to change them there awesome. The officer is the same from the at-st except for the hat which is lighter then his body. My favorite is the at-at driver just for the sole purpose of his awesome helmet, which is brand new and super detailed. This set wont let you down. 5/5"

author: michaelvader
title: The Reble Forces Are Closeing In!
review:
I Got This At Target Too, With The Space Poilce Set. Now I Made a Review On BOTH Battle Packs!

pros:

awesome speeder

I Like This Set Alot! 5/5 Or 10/10

author: flyguy
title: again minifig and speeder heaven
review:
awesome for minifigs, my first snowtrooper, and at-at driver cost me a fortune so nice to get three here for $18.67AUD!
One other review complained they had black heads, not sure what he was expecting but that's what shines through the white helmet...

Speeder, same as endor set but white and just great, absolutely love it and it works with the figure I guess because we saw speeders in the movie.

The imperial station or mini base is not bad at all way better than the awful 'ice cutter for the rebel battle pack, but then baddies always have the fun and cool equipment. The missile I love, very cool indeed.

It's basic , simple and reasonably priced, no wonder this will sell in droves.

More please lego!

author: parchioso
title: More than just minifigs
review:
Personally I believe that this can easily be the best value lego 2010 Starwar set so far, 4 very useful minifigs (all four of them), including two much in demand Snowtroopers, new AT-AT Driver and Imperial Officer are sufficient reason to get it, but in addition, the speeder bike is a nice surprise.

Considering the appearance of speeder bikes in older sets, this one is probably the best, and has very good degree of playability, it is a perfect match for the Snowtroopers, using this set along with 8083, plus a little elements from 7749, I have built a fun MOC at:

http://brickand.me/2010/01/14/DeadlyResistanceOnHothALegoMOCUsing80838084And7749.aspx 

I have also make a pictorial set review at:
http://brickand.me/2010/01/14/8084ProbablyTheBestValue2010LegoStarwarsSet.aspx

And I think the mini outpost is well designed too, with something that can move to play with despite being small and simple.

author: turboteabagger

review:
pros,
speeder bike is kick very cool, 
nice selection of troopers, 
you get a long rifle
extra back pack on the speeder bike
a set if bionouclers

author: chavez247
title: March of the Empire!
review:
I just picked up this set along with the Hoth Trooper Battle Pack, and despite the outrageous prices(CHF 25.90 for each), I`m very pleased. I`m trying to recreate the battle on Hoth, and these battle packs will really help. This little beauty comes with four figures, a small outpost(emphasis on small), and a white speeder.

The figures are all good. As I mentioned before, there are four of them: two snowtroopers, an AT-AT driver, and a grey Death Star Trooper. The snowtroopers are good, and are worth having since they're fairly rare, coming in only a handful of sets, a majority of which are pretty expensive. They're the same as all the other snowtroopers released; a head piece with a backpack attached, a white torso, white arms, and white legs. The heads are black.
The AT-AT driver is a gem. Found only in the AT-ATs(well, duh), he is exceptionally rare. He is of a new mold, with a large, detailed helmet that has two Imperial insignias on it. The torso has some sort of life support pack depicted on it, and then just regular old grey legs. As with all stormtroopers, there is a black head.

Finally, we have the Death Star Trooper. He is the same as any other one of his kind, except he is all grey. Grey helmet, grey body, grey legs, grey arms. On his torso he has a sort of plate, or chest protector. 

Then we have the small outpost. It comes on a small white plate, and consists of a radar and a small cannon. There is a radar piece with nice detail and a radar dish. Under that there are two gun holders. And next to that we have the cannon. It's basically a holder that can be moved by a cog joined to it by an axle. This is on a small plate resting on top of one of those spinning plates. The missile is flick-fire and looks quite nice. There is a sort of seat for the operator. There are some good pieces here, either transparent red or white.
Last, but not least, the speeder. It's pretty much the same as the ones in The Battle of Endor and the Republic Attack Gunship. However, it's white and grey, not brown, and the front rods with the two small flat plates are not just straight but like the old lances in the castle sets.
This set comes with a pair of macrobinoculars, two blasters, and two blaster rifles.
Overall, a great set, worth buying doubles of(as I plan to do), and a great army builder. I shall end this review with the pros and cons.

Pros:

AT-AT driver
Snowtroopers
Imperial trooper
Neat little outpost
Speeder
Great army builder
Good flick-fire missile
Some rare pieces

Cons:

None

Thanks for reading!
chavez247 out.

author: SkyBrick
title: Great Set!
review:
I bought this set for $10.99 at Meijer. It is a great set! It was fun to build and has a very good amount of minifigures for $10.99. Interesting to note that the minifigures almost parallel with those of the Clone Walker Battle Pack: Two troopers for battle (Snowtroopers), one gunner (AT-AT Driver), and one commander (Imperial Officer). The set comes with the new speeder bike, which has a cool smooth-looking design. It also comes with a mini-base complete with radar, blaster holders, and a small flick-fire missile launcher platform. The minifigures include two snowtroopers, which is pretty cool since before you could only get snowtroopers in more expensive sets, like the AT-AT Walkers and the Hoth Millenium Falcon. The other two minifigures are a AT-AT Driver and Imperial Officer. Both are cool, especially a real Imperial officer to command your troops, but the AT-AT Driver's (very well detailed) helmet seems a little big compared to the rest of the body. 

Pros--

-Great value for money.
-Fun to play with if you have some Rebel troopers.
-Cool minifigures.
-Sweet speeder bike.

Cons--

-Flick-fire missile launcher is not very easy to fire efficiently, however, if you want to use it as a gun or just pull out the missile to make it hit its target, it works fine for that too. 
-AT-AT Driver's head seems a little big in proportion with the rest of the body.

Overall a great set, I rate it 4.8 out of 5.

author: Carl
title: Good thing they have those heat packs because this set is COOL
review:
This is yet another pretty decent trooper battlepack. However, because it is small, the building experience goes down becuase there just arent enough pieces to make it that enjoyable to build that I give it a 5/5 for said category. But that doesn't mean I don't like it. O the contrary; I LOVE IT!

Pros
  • Cool minifigs -a nice easy cheap way to get rare snowtroopers
  • Cool bike
  • Nice station thing
  • Cool turret
Cons
  • Not much room on the station thing for the minifgs that don't  go on the bike
This is a really cool set and I am positive that every Star Wars LEGO collector should have at least 1 of these awesome battle packs.

PS: I myself cannot wait for 2013; 30th Anniversary of Return of the Jedi, which means Endor Rebel battle packs and Scout Trooper battle packs! Plus hopefully a new Jabba's Palace ( :) :) :) :) :) :)! Maybe a Rancor this time and more alien minifigs), more Ewoks ( maybe you might get one in the Endor Rebel battlepacks? ) and I'm hoping maybe for a new Yoda's hovel that doesn't have a great big X-Wing attached.
  •

author: Duq
title: It's Hoth, but not as we know it.
review:
I picked up this little set to accompany some other storm troopers on a bookshelf. And because it's Star Wars classic. Sort of. Neither the battle station nor the speeder bike actually appears in the Hoth battle in episode V.

The little battle station isn't very interesting. Only a handful of parts including a flick-missile. I'm not a fan of the flick-missiles; I'd prefer more details. For children they add playability though.

The white speeder bike looks great. The design is very clever and similar to that in the Battle of Endor set (8038). It's slightly longer because of different parts being used.

Four minifigs and a speeder bike in a small cheap set it pretty good going so I'm giving it full marks for value for money. I really like the look of the snowtroopers. The commander is good too but I'm not so sure why there's an AT-AT driver manning the gun.

Overall a fun little set. The battle station will be good fun for kids but I would have preferred two speeders.

author: daniel1000
title: Great set!
review:
i got this set at my local toys r us, because i thought it would go great with 8129 at-at.


As soon as I got home I ripped the box open and started building:


Building Experience


it was relatively easy to build, I got it done in about 3 minutes, and it was a thoroughly enjoyable build.


Set


It is a very nice set, the command centre being the best part, as the speeder was nothing special. The command centre's gun is not particularly  good at flick fire, but looks nice and rotates 360 degrees.


Minifigures


The minifigures look amazing, with the atat driver looking the best. The imperial officer was good considering they are rarely featured in sets, Although the snow troopers are nothing amazing, this is an army builder. No onto the pros and cons.

PROS'N'CONS


  • Pros


    cool minifigs: atat driver

    nice command center

    cool speeder

    great value for money


    CONs


    nuthin' really

     


Thank you for taking the time to read my review

author: Loganwan
title: Who doesn't love a Speeder Bike
review:
I am really glad we finally get some Hoth battle packs.  This one is good.  I am a huge, I mean HUGE fan of the speeder bikes, and to get one that is a snow speeder bike is even better.  I do wish we would have gotten a snow scout trooper like we did with the 3 3/4 line two pack that came out last year.  As ususal, it probably all comes down to money, so I would rather have  a second snow trooper.

I am not really excited about the little base of operations with the missle launcher, since the guy is totally unprotected and it just sits out in the middle of nowhere.  And how many of these could the Empire really have out there anyway.  There are good part on it though, with a really nice looking missile.

If you are gearing up for an assault on Hoth, then this is a good set to get.  Probably 10 or so would be best.  So far this is my first, but I am definitely going back for more.

author: avsa
title: Snowtroopers, attack!
review:
tHis is such an awesome set.  It comes with 2 snowtroopers, an at-at driver, and an Imperial general, all of which are rare minifigs. The mini base and the speeder are awesome, and a lot bases can make an awesome big base!  Now for the pros and cons:

Pros

  • awesome minifigs
  • Speeder is a great addition
  • rocket launcher looks awesome
  • good parts
  • flick fire is easy to use

Cons

  • everyone(except general) have black heads

Definitly a must have to build your Imperial army or to recreate the battle of hoth

author: THX_1138
title: One of the better battle packs
review:
As said in the title, this is probably one of the better battle packs.

  • Pros:
  • The price is fair for what you get
  • Cheapest way to get snowtroopers
  • New AT-AT pilot
  • New torso for the AT-AT commander
  • The bike is pretty good, at least for a battle pack vehicle
  • There are a couple useful parts in the missile launcher

  • Cons:
  • Not a major complaint, but I would have preferred the bike to have been built more like the ones in the Battle of Endor set, with the shorter poles and grey lightsaber hilts instead of just long black poles
  • The missile base thing isn't much good
  • I think the AT-AT pilot's helmet is a little big (it's not as bad in person as it looked in pictures, though)
  • The AT-AT commander's helmet would look a little better in dark bley
This is a pretty good set, overall.

author: power_miner2020
title: 30 years of the empire strikes back with a hoth set!
review:
I got this set in wal-mart.The price was only $10.95 or somthing like that.Pros and cons are next so let's begin.

  • pros
  • cool new speeder
  • a little base
  • new imperial officer in 2010
  • new at-at driver in 2010

 

 

 

 

  • cons
  • none
  • Well that is it see you next time.

author: shiloa437
title: Awesome army builder
review: This is a great army builder for the hoth battle fans but this is only good for battles on snow planets on the other hand its the least expensive way of getting snow troopers they normaly came in very expensive sets but now you can get them in battle packs :-) the only problems with this set is if you destroy it you cant build much out of the parts also the at-at driver's helmet is awesome but a little big :-/ and if you get more than one what do you do with all those little basses probably combine them into a bigger one but anyhow this is an awesome army builder if you see it still in stock get one.

author: desire4one
title: ROTC Graduate needs troops that won't hide in the snow...
review:
As a huge fan of Empire Strikes Back, I bought this set as soon as I saw it in my local Lego store.  This was purchased along with the Rebel Battle Pack and the Freco Speeder.  Certainly made for some fun in the snow.  For the low price of $11, you get a Speeder Bike snow themed, an Imperial Officer, an AT-AT pilot and a rotating anti-aircraft missle.  Could you ask for anything more?

  • The most impressive piece, in my opinion, is the Imperial Officer.  His chest piece and helmet make the set.  As someone with 16 stormtroopers to command, an officer was a neccesity to keep the ranks in line.
  • The AT-AT pilot is a nice addition.  I didn't expect so see him for awhile and he begs to pilot your newest Imperial vehicle.
  • The snow-bike offers a little vehicle, perfect for scouting enemy positions. 
  • Rotation/moving pieces are rare in a battle pack and the missle launcher was a welcome addition. 

Again, this is rare for me to say, but I don't have anything negative to say about the set.  It is a great value for the money, and a must have for a dedicated Star Wars fan.

author: ceroknight
title: Good Addition to a Hoth Set But....Not a Good Set Itself......
review:
I got the last one in my local Walmart and here is what I have to say about it:
 

Minifigures/Accessories:

AMAZING minifigs: two snowtroopers, an AT-AT pilot and an Imperial officer. The redesigned AT-AT helmet is MASSIVE and alot of the back is exposed. Snowies are just amazing and the officer is quite chill.
The accessories are kinda off as there was one less weapon and I dont know why there is a backpack on the speeder.....
 

Building:

Building was decent but that was because this was only a battlepack....anyhow this is my first speeder but I had built the Endor one for my local TRU (happened to be at the right place at the right time :-P) and this one seems less detailed. However I love the colour scheme. The base was easy to build and it isnt so bad....
 

Playability:
 

Like I mentioned before this would be good if it was in a set like the upcoming AT-AT (it would explain the Pilot too) There isn't much functions in it and you can't really recreate the movie because I haven't see these in it.....

By the way my ratings are .5 off because I dont know how to do a half a brick so this is what I thought: Overall:4.5 Building:3.5 Parts:4.5 Playability: 3.5 Value:4.5

Its a good set go get it!!

author: bird2k9
title: Let the battle begin!
review:
I have both battle packs and this one is my favorite of the two

For £9 it wasent great value and the set seems to be missing somthing (another tropper would be nice) but its not bad

pros and cons:

pros:

2 rare snowtroppers

a new at-at pilot

new imperial officer

the missile station is sweet

speeder bike is cool

 

cons:

needs another snowtrooper

one person wont get a blaster

I do recommend getting this set, but get the rebel one for more fun

author: Snowtrooper76
title: Intéressant, mais pas exceptionnel.
review:
Le désappointement de tous les fans Lego Star Wars est le peu de personnages que contient chaque set. Celui-ci est intéressant : 2 snowtroopers, l'officier, et le pilote du AT-ST. Le speeder bike des neiges est franchement top, une merveille. Par la suite, j'en ai acheté 5 de plus pour constituer un petit détachement.

Comme la plupart, je m'interroge devant la pauvreté du missile. Quel intérêt a-t-il ? On se le demande. Vous imaginez les gars poser ça directement dans la neige (scène d'intro de l'Empire Contre-Attaque) au milieu du blizzard ? Non, pas crédible. Un 2ème speeder bike eut été plus adéquat pour justifier le prix.

A ce sujet, à quand des lots spéciaux uniquement composés de mini-figurines de l'Empire ou de la République, troopers et clones, afin que les fans puissent facilement constituer leur armée ? Lego devrait y réfléchir, ces lots spéciaux se vendraient comme des petits pains et raviraient les fans. Rien n'est impossible, depuis 1999 cette gamme a connu une belle évolution.

Bonne construction à tous !

author: Firox_5000
title: Small , powerful and good value
review:
This is the 2010 bad guy battle pack.

 

The set includes two snow troopers,  a gun shooter and commander.  The set also includes a white snow speeder which is quite big and long and can fit a figure on top. There is also a small command post included which is a really nice addition in the set. there is a stand for the commander ot control and watch as well as a missile launcher.

 

The set for £10 is probably the biggest battle pack made for three years and is a must have for star wars fans world wide. To increase playability I also recomend the Rebeltrooper battle pack  as well.

 

Buy it , you wont regret it.

author: lego_octan_guy
title: Great set, Great minifigs!
review: This is my faveourite set so far, besides my octan mag racer! It has great minifigs, especially the snowtroopers, there is only a few sets withsnowtroopers. And it comes with a snow speeder and a platform base type thing. The only tning i think it should've come with a 4th blaster, 1 for each minifig.

author: live2servehm
title: "You should NOT have come back." -Darth Vader
review:
This is a great set. like the title, if i were the Rebels, I would Not have wanted to come back.
  • Pros:
  • White Speeder bike. (Only came in the AT-AT)
  • Flick Fire Missile.
  • Minifigs. (Especially The AT-AT Driver and Imperial Officer)
  • Imperial Officer Battle Station.
  • Great Detail.

  • Cons:
  • Could have done a LITTLE more with the battle station.
  • Speeder practically same design as Plo Koon's

          The only reason i gave it four stars in building experience and parts is because it's a small set. Not much more they could have done with it. I Give it 9/10 because i'd like the speeder a little more original. Great set. See it, buy it.

author: Huge_Nerd
title: a good set with unique parts and mini-figs
review:
I had been eyeing this set for awhile and it was the free chrome Stormtrooper at Toys R Us that finally made me pull the trigger--and am I glad I did!

  • Pros
  • Two cool, very detailed Snowtroopers (as detailed as guys designed to blend in with snow can get!)
  • Awesome AT-AT drive with very detailed chest piece and helmet (the helmet is especially impressive)
  • An Imp. Officer to lead the troops
  • White speeder bike with a creative build
  • Outpost with a nice, but simple radar station and fun missile turret that flick-fires a big, impressive missile--perfect for shooting down snowspeeders or blowing up bunkers!
  • Many parts you don't see often.

  • Cons
  • Now I need more Hoth sets! (which is only a con for my wallet!)

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Snowtrooper Battle Pack
review:
The Snowtrooper Battle Pack set (8084) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2010. It comes with 4 minifigs and 74 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8084-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

  • Imperial Officer: The imperial officer comes with a gray helmet and a pair of binoculars. He comes with a gray uniform which is double-printed. He also has the same face as Bruce Wayne (Batman). 
  • AT-AT driver: The AT-AT driver has a new helmet design which looks really detailed. He has a black head under his helmet and his uniform is double printed. 
  • Snowtrooper (2x): The snowtroopers are not very special. They also come with black heads and a cool helmet piece which is attached to the backpack. They have white uniforms and no back-printing. One of them has a long blaster.
Speeder Bike:

The speeder bike looks very detailed. The seat is the same piece which we've seen in the old LEGO Town theme from 1998-2000 a lot. It comes with two blasters in the front and a white backpack on the back. There're two joysticks and two skis which are movable.

The base:

The base looks really cool: We get a computer and a radar where you can also see two blasters. On the other side of the base you can see a turret. There's a place for the AT-AT driver to sit and a gear which you can turn to move the flick-missile up and down.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Price
Minifigures
Nice army builders
No stickers

Negative:

Not so many play features
Too easy to build

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Cal_Zagy
title: A Great Hoth Set
review:
I bought this set a few months ago and I was pleasantly surprised. I recently got the Rebel Trooper Battle Pack this Christmas and both sets are a great compliment one and other.

The Speeder Bike: It's a pretty basic and easy build. It is also has a good playability. It is similar in design to the (ancient) speeder bike which came with Ewok Attack (a set I own), but has the improved Clone Wars-era design that can be seen in the Republic Attack Gunship and The Battle for Endor sets. As it is a diffirent colour to these other speeders it is unique to the set.
  • Pros:
-Very simple design.
-Relatively easy build.
-The Snowtrooper can hold onto the controls.
  • Cons:
-Non really, it's similar to the ones that can be found in two other sets.

The Base: It's very basic in construction and design. The flick-fire is quite intresting as it actually resembles a missile. However, the little base seems to serve little purpose more than just housing the AT-AT Driver and the Officer.
  • Pros:
-It provides a place to put the minifigs.
-Little clips to store the guns (is pretty useful)
-The missile can be moved up and down
  • Cons
-I feel it could have easily been expanded and it would have benifited from a few extra pieces.
-The flick fire missile can be a bit fiddly to fire.

The Minifigs: Well... They are the main reason I bought the set. I like the Snowtroopers and the Imperial Officer (as it is exclusive to the set) but I felt the AT-AT Driver was a little out of place.
  • Pros:
-Neat decals on the (exclusive) Imperial Officer and the AT-AT Driver
-New AT-AT Driver helmet
-Binoculars
-Snowtroopers
  • Cons:
-There are only three guns (1 rifle, 2 blasters), so one of them has to go without.

Overall: It's a decent set, but I feel it could have had a few more pieces added to the base. It is also rather overpriced. However, whether you are looking to expand your Imperial Army, wanting to re-create the Battle of Hoth, like Star Wars or are just a collector; this is the set for you.

author: Seagull
title: Best Battle Pack Yet
review:
Ok, this is my first review, so, here it goes!

• Pros

- 2 Snowtroopers.
- New AT-AT driver with an amazing new helmet!
- General Veers(?).
- Speeder Bike design is spectacular!

• Cons

- The 'battle station' could've been a little more exciting, but with the retail price, I guess it was the best LEGO could do.

• Overall

Very good set, actually the best battle pack so far. The two new minifigures made it even better. Building the speeder was fun, and the outcome was great. The battle packs are a little overpriced in my opinion, but, in the end, it's worth it!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Lord Vader you may Start your Approach
review:
Set #8084 Snowtrooper Battle Pack: LEGO Star Wars Battle Packs continue to impress.

 

The Snowtrooper Battle Pack gives us three things, an Imperial Speeder Bike for Hoth, more Snowtroopers, more Imperial AT-AT Drivers and an Imperial Commander. Four Mini-Figures make up the bulk of the reason for picking this set up, the vehicle isn't bad either, but I have to wonder privately at that small weapons outpost with rocket launcher... When did they have time to make one of those during the Hoth Attack?

 

This build is surprisingly fast, my set was missing a piece unfortunately and I'm not sure if it was due to the fact that I started building it in the parking lot while waiting for my ride home or if it was because that part is missing from the set at the factory level... I'll have to pick up a second one to know for sure. (And I had a spare of that piece anyway, the little black nozzle part, so I'm covered in case that happens again.)

 

Overall this is a great Battle Pack and a worthy addition to the 30th Anniversary of Empire Strikes Back, there are a lot more uses for multiples of this set than the Hoth Rebel Troopers one, since four of the three Mini-Figures are generic and the fourth one is simply called AT-AT Commander/Imperial Commander so you could use multiples of him anywhere really. Strongly Recommended for Hoth and Empire fans.

author: wander099
title: Terrible missile
review:
Box/Instructions

The box is nice, you get a clear picture of the snow speeder.  As for the instructions, they are fairly simple, just like the new Clone Trooper Battle Pack.

Parts

Nothing too special here except for the main body of the speeder.  There are no stickers and you get one printed piece.

Minifigures

This is what the battle packs are all about.  You get four: two snow troopers, one imperial officer, and one AT-AT pilot.  The best figure in this set is the AT-AT driver, he's got great markings on his helmet and torso and is only available in this set and the expensive AT-AT walker set.  The imperial officer is also pretty good, this version is exclusive to this set so far and in my opinion one of the better versions.  The snowtroopers are pretty good (a cheap way to add a couple more to your army), my only complaint is that the backpacks are attached to the helmets and cannot be removed.  It doesn't really hinder play, it just annoys me.

The build

The build is fast and pretty easy.  Younger kids will be able to do it (I know a 7 year old who managed to build this one by himself, without any help).

The completed model

The completed model is pretty good.  The speeder sits nicely on the table and is a great design.  I like the way the hand controls are designed (same as in the Clone Trooper battle pack for this year), but I'm not sure why the speeder is not entirely symmetrical (on one side there is a black cone piece, like the pieces used for the old guns, but on the other there isn't).

As for the base, it looks nice and the missile rotates (laterally and vertically), but the flick fire missile is terrible (worst one I have encountered so far).  I simply cannot get the missile to fire how it is supposed to, it requires picking up the base and applying a great deal of force.

Summary

I would recommend this battle pack despite the failing of the flickfire missile.  At $14.99 CDN it is a relatively cheap set and what it does include makes it worth the price you pay.  The figures alone make this worth buying and with a great speeder like this you can't go wrong.  The base looks nice, so it can still be played with without the flickfire missile function (you can still aim it and pretend to fire).  This set is good for young kids, older kids, and adults as all age groups will find something about this set to be great (whether it is the easy build, minifigures, speeder, base, or a combination of the above).

author: Steamrunner
title: Ingenious use of parts
review:
Bought one of these in the Argos sale for a Star Wars-loving mate as a desk toy, and decided to get one for myself too.

The choice of characters is a bit odd - the AT-AT bloke looks totally out of place, as does the Officer chap - the others are all in arctic gear and he's supposedly out in the snow in hos regular suit? And the "base station" thing just looks like a few bricks stuck together. It's going in the parts bin. Oh, and why on earth do the blokes with cloths over their faces only get black heads? Why not normal heads with faces? We know they have faces, they're not robots! The AT-AT bloke gets a face even though he wears a full helmet, so why not the other two?

However, the speeder is a lovely bit of design, and I'm really impressed with the clever use of pieces. From what I can see, they've used road signs for the plates at the front, lances (?) for the front end, robot arms and fire hose handles for the control levers (very clever) and a motorbike chassis on skis for the rest of it. Not bad at all!

If the set was, say, two speeders but a couple of quid less, I think it'd be much better. As it is, the base thing is just weird, but if you get it in a sale it's worth it for the speeder. Don't pay full price for it, though.

author: Duckuss_Maxximus
title: 8084-1 Snowtrooper battle pack - Building A Better Army
review:
This set is better by far compared to the rebel one (8083) . Snowtroopers have always been cool. Set also includes an AT-AT Pilot and an Imperial Officer. The speeder is pretty sweet. If you remove the stuff behind the seat you can seat two comfortably. The playset is small yet functional. The missle launches pretty ok. Not really much else to this set.

Pros

  • Good Minifig builder*
  • Snowspeeder*
  • Flick missle turret*

Cons

  • Small PaysetX
  • Duplicate charactersX

It's really just a good addition to the other Hoth sets and a good way to build your minifig collection.

author: StratTone
title: Not the best
review: This set gets you your moneys worth if you are interested in the figures only.  The vehicles and whatever the other thing is are ho-hum IMO.  A must have if you love the snow but not that great compared to other sets in the price range.

author: dcmal
title: Not bad, but some issues
review:
Building experience

The instructions are clear. The snowspeeder and command stand are easy to build. As you build the model, there were some positive surprises, but also three major disappointments (see section "Parts").

The completed model

The completed model is satisfactory. The snowspeeder is convincing. The command stand is very abstract and hence not convincing in itself. But I still like the way it calls for imagination.
I like the addition of small details in the model, i.e. the separate backpack on the snowspeeder (reminded me of the additional oxygen tanks on Classic Space buggies, i.e. 886) and the weapons clamps next to the radar screen.

Playability

Being an AFOL, I did not play much with this set, but I can see how it might be fun, particularly in combination with 8083 Rebel Trooper Battle Pack. The snowspeeder is sufficiently swooshable to play with, and with a bit of imagination, the command stand can be put to good use.

Parts

Practically all parts in this model are either white, dark-gray or black. Some of them are really useful, especially for a smaller collection (spears, triangular signs etc.).
Half of the snowspeeder is unnecessarily one element (previously used for trikes) and difficult to re-use (although it can be an interesting challenge). I would have preferred the snow speeder body to be constructed from smaller pieces.
Three of the four minifigures have a black head without print. Admitted, the black heads have their uses, too. Still, it is a bit cheap.
Disappointingly, the snowtrooper helmets and backpacks form one part, rather than being two separate parts, helmet and backpack - very much not in the spirit of reuse and modularity.

Overall

This is a good addition to other sets or a Lego collection. It seems to be a bit random and non-canon for Star Wars fans. As standalone or very first Lego set, it remains too limited.

author: SanMams91
title: Snowtroopers galore!
review:
Parts

Honestly, not too many parts can be used from this set. Most have been seen before.

Minifigures

?This is a battle pack, so clearly the minifigures are in the spotlight! The Snowtrooper design from back then was perfect. They're perfect even now in 2015, but back then, I really wanted a Snowtrooper figure without having to purchase one of the larger sets to get one. You also got a now inaccurate AT-AT Driver, who still is a fantastic figure. Lastly you get an imperial officer in a Hoth outfit, which was surprising, but not a. Bad inclusion for this set.

The build

Build was super quick, I enjoyed building the Snowtrooper speeder the most. 

Overall

I got this set and never looked back. I got two snowtroopers, and a couple of cool extras!

author: BrickFactoryINC
title: Great first set
review: This set was the second set I had ever received after the clone wars y wing.  But for being a small set it is defiantly amity.  This set has a good selection of minifigs with the AT-AT pilot, General Veres, and the 2 classic og snow troopers.  The build is very easy and looks good in a battle scene and is very functional in a battle scene.  For a battle pack, it defiantly is an easy way in this year to get a lot of snow troopers and easy.  Would defiantly suggest this set.

author: Captainfives1514
title: The Original Snowtroopers
review:
This is a good old LEGO battle pack. That came with an imperial speeder and an imperial command post.

  This set comes with an Imperial Officer he is wearing imperial assault armour. With a rank indicator. His pants are plain grey.

  There is also included an AT-AT pilot. His armour is white with a heater pack printed on his torso. His head is a black blank minifigure head. His helmet has red imperial logos printed on it.

  There are also two old version Snowtroopers. There helmets are moulded to there heat packs. There torsos are printed with heavy weather gear. There legs are plain white with grey hips.

  The build is pretty simple with not many interesting pieces. You get a speeder with an old motorbike rear chassis built in. Also command post with a console and a rocket launch pad/turret. That launches a flick missile. I have never had much success with flick missiles though. 
  Overall this is an enjoyable set. One of the best sets I would say of two thousand and ten.
